Corners are sliced off a unit cube so that the six faces each become regular octagons. What is the total volume of the removed tetrahedra?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \frac {5\sqrt {2} - 7}{3}\qquad \textbf{(B)}\ \frac {10 - 7\sqrt {2}}{3}\qquad \textbf{(C)}\ \frac {3 - 2\sqrt {2}}{3}\qquad \textbf{(D)}\ \frac {8\sqrt {2} - 11}{3}\qquad \textbf{(E)}\ \frac {6 - 4\sqrt {2}}{3}$
